data.comment: Name on top of view About

data.name: textAboutDataProtection1.Text
data.value: You have probably selected Friendica as your preferred social network because you have doubts about privacy on the well-known global networks. Also I take privacy very seriously. The app is designed so that as little data as possible must be stored on the Smartphone - as a result, the data need to be reloaded from your server each time you start the app.
data.comment: About.xaml: general statement to data protection

data.name: textAboutDataProtection2.Text
data.value: Storing user data on the device is necessary for some features, other apps may not access to this data. When roaming for using the app on multiple devices, it is necessary that some information are stored on Microsoft servers to keep the devices in sync. The app has been programmed so that stored information contain any personal data. You can switch on or off these functions in the settings, as well as interactions with other apps (contacts, pictures, Cortana, etc.).
data.comment: About.xaml: description of data exchange function for system integration

data.name: textAboutDataProtection3.Text
data.value: This app collects any usage statistics. In addition, no information is received from your Friendica account to me as a developer or to a website associated with me! The affiliate receive no information for the ads in test mode from your Friendica Server!
data.comment: About.xaml: declaration of non-sending information from the user to the developer

data.name: textAboutDescriptionPart1.Text
data.value:
Friendica (formerly known as the Friendika) is a decentralized social network, which is constructed as an open source application. In contrast to Facebook, the personal data are not collected in a central database and are therefore not exposed to be part of a central analysis for advertising purposes.
This app for Windows needs the credentials for an existing Friendica account. If you don't have yet your own Friendica server with an account, you must setup a server and an account before using this app. Alternatively you can register an account on a public servers. You will find a list of available servers, as well as more information about the Friendica project on the official project homepage
data.comment: About.xaml: description text on Friendica project

data.name: textAboutDescriptionPart2.Text
data.value: Please keep in mind that this app is NOT published and maintained by the Friendica project team. If you want to report problems/bugs or have questions, please use the following contact options:
data.comment: About.xaml: description text on App support

data.name: textAboutDisclaimer.Text
data.value: THIS SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED 'AS IS', WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE AUTHORS OR COPYRIGHT HOLDERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, DAMAGES OR OTHER LIABILITY, WHETHER IN ANY ACTION OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, ARISING FROM, OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR OTHER DEALINGS IN THE SOFTWARE.
data.comment: About.xaml: disclaimer

data.name: textblockNotificationActivatedHint.Text
data.value:
The app can ask at regular intervals on the server if there are new posts. In this case, you get a notification with the sender, the sent time, as well as the start of the content. The messages are located in the Windows Info Center.
Asking the server is done in the background, the app will not be started to do so. Please make sure in the Windows settings, that the app is allowed to be run in the background (Privacy/background apps) and notifications are displayed (System/notifications & actions).
You can additionally display the number of new notifications on the lock screen. To do this, select Friendica mobile as one of up to seven apps (Personalization/Lock screen).
data.comment: Settings.xaml: hint on checkbox for activating toast notifications

data.name: textblockNotificationFreshnessTimeHint
data.value: The app checks your account all {0} minutes for new messages.
data.comment: Settings.xaml:

data.name: textHelpAppSupport1.Text
data.value: Do you have questions about this app for Windows? Have problems occured to you, that you would like to share with the developers (bug reporting)? Are there important Friendica features which you are missing in the Windows app? Or do you want to keep yourself informed on the further development of the app?
data.comment: Help.xaml: 1st paragraph introducing link to forum "Friendica Mobile Support"

data.name: textHelpAppSupport2.Text
data.value: Then, the support forum of Friendica Mobile is the right place for you. If you are connected to the Forum, you can create posts, like on posts or comment them. News end up in your timeline.
data.comment: Help.xaml: 2nd paragraph introducing link to forum "Friendica Mobile Support"

data.name: textHelpFriendicaDevelopers.Text
data.value: In addition, there is a forum where the involved developers of Friendica interact about enhancements and bug fixes. You are welcome to submit your wishes here and discuss on the issues. If you have experience in programming with PHP, you can engage yourself here also as a developer in the community.
data.comment: Help.xaml: paragraph introducing link to forum "Friendica Developers"

data.name: textHelpFriendicaOthers1.Text
data.value: You can also find the whole open-source project on
data.comment: Help.xaml: 1st sentence noting other resources - followed by link to github page

data.name: textHelpFriendicaOthers2.Text
data.value: There are also additional information and documentation. You can also find more information on
data.comment: Help.xaml: 2nd sentence noting other resources - followed by link to friendica.com (then paragraph ends)

data.name: textHelpFriendicaSupport.Text
data.value: If you have questions, problems, suggestions etc. to Friendica in General, you can contact the support forum. People from the team of developers and experienced users will help you there. You can contribute to the project even without coding skills, all kind of help is appreciated.
data.comment: Help.xaml: paragraph introducing link to forum "Friendica Support"

data.name: textblockProfilesHelp1.Text
data.value: With the information in your profile you can tell more about you to the public and to your friends.
data.comment: Profiles.xaml: detailed information about profiles in Friendica - part 1

data.name: textblockProfilesHelp2.Text
data.value: Here you can control very well, who can see certain information about you. Friendica has an unusual way of privacy settings at a glance. There is always a public profile in Friendica, which basically can see everyone on the Internet. In addition, you may attach as many private profiles. They contain the information that may see only those persons whom you allow access to this profile. You can use different profile pictures for the different private profiles. Before you can use this option, you may only need to enable this feature. You can find this in your Web access under "Settings / extra features / multiple profiles" (by default, this feature is often disabled).
data.comment: Profiles.xaml: detailed information about profiles in Friendica - part 2

data.name: textblockProfilesHelp3.Text
data.value: The users button in the toolbar shows the persons who may see the selected profile.
data.comment: Profiles.xaml: detailed information about profiles in Friendica - part 3

data.name: textblockProfilesHelp4.Text
data.value: With the adjacent drop-down box, you can select which profile you want to display below. If the selected profile is generally publicly visible on the Internet, you can see this on the red border around the drop-down box.
data.comment: Profiles.xaml: detailed information about profiles in Friendica - part 4

data.name: textblockProfilesHelp5.Text
data.value: The public profile is published by default in the global directory of Friendica (to turn off: in the Web access under settings/user account/security and privacy settings). If this is the case for your public profile, you can see on the check of the following check box. Since there are global multiple servers for the global directory, you will find a link to the directory, which is used on your server as the primary directory.
data.comment: Profiles.xaml: detailed information about profiles in Friendica - part 5

data.name: textblockProfilesNoServerSupport.Text
data.value: Your Friendica server does not yet support the necessary API commands for displaying profiles. Please update your server on Friendica 3.5.1 or later or ask your administrator.
data.comment: Profiles.xaml: info to user if there was an error on loading the profiles, caused by missing API calls

data.name: textblockSettingsSaveLocalAllowedHint2.Text
data.value: When function is activated, the images of your photo albums on the device are stored (app its own space). This allows a faster switch between your photo albums, and the images of an album, because only still newly added images are loaded from the server (useful even if your data volume at the mobile operator is not very large).
data.comment: Settings.xaml: 2nd hint on SaveLocalAllowed regarding caching of photos

data.name: textblockSaveFullsizePhotosAllowedHint.Text
data.value: For large photo collections the local storing of the full screen files can consume much space on your device. You can disable the storing of full size photos to reduce memory consumption. The smaller thumbnails are still saved, but it takes a little longer until you can see the full size photos in good resolution.
data.comment: Settings.xaml: user can disable the saving of fullsize photos on the local device to save disk space, this is the hint for this option

data.name: pagePhotoRights.FlowDirection
data.comment: Defines Text direction for the language

data.name: pageTitlePhotoRights.Text
data.comment: Name on top of view A6_PhotoRights.xaml

data.name: checkboxPhotoIsCommentedLiked.Content
data.comment: PhotoRights.xaml: checkbox indicating that photo has been commented or liked already (has implication on changing rights now)

data.name: checkboxPhotoACLMismatch.Content
data.comment: PhotoRights.xaml: checkbox indicating that access rights of photo and access rights of comments are differeing

data.name: textblockPhotoRightsHelp1.Text
data.value: The subsequent change of photo permissions is fundamentally problematic. Existing comments and likes of your contacts keep the visibility settings even after the change. Therefore, the app usually deletes the previous photo and upload it for you with the new permissions again. This has resulted in that already existing comments and likes are also deleted. In addition, existing links on the photo (e.g. in a posting) can become unusable.
data.comment: PhotoRights.xaml: text shown in the flyout when user taps the help button - explaining the issue with photo rights when changing them

data.name: textblockPhotoRightsHelp2.Text
data.value: If you turn off "New upload", the app customizes the permissions on the photo as desired, but the comments/likes remain unchanged. The links in existing posts etc. also remain thereby, but unwanted side effects can occur. Here you can see whether there are these variations between photo- and comment rights for the selected photo.
data.comment: PhotoRights.xaml: text shown in the flyout when user taps the help button- explaining the issue wiht photo rights when changing them

data.name: checkboxPhotoUploadNew.Content
data.comment: PhotoRights.xaml: checkbox where user can disable the new upload of a photo after changing rights (then it will only update photo rights on server)

data.name: textPhotoRightsAddContact
data.value: If the photo is not newly uploaded, the newly added group/contacts may not submit any comments/likes. They do not see existing comments/likes.
data.comment: PhotoRights.xaml: show hint after changing rights to what implications this change could have

data.name: textPhotoRightsChangePrivToPub
data.value: If the photo is not newly uploaded, the already existing comments and/or likes remain visible only to the previously authorized group/contacts. And only they can add more comments. Your other contacts see your photo after the change in your profile, but without the previous comments/likes, but cannot post own comments or like your photo.
data.comment: PhotoRights.xaml: show hint after changing rights to what implications this change could have

data.name: textPhotoRightsChangePubToPriv
data.value: If the photo is not newly uploaded, the already existing entries remain public and will therefore remain on the community page of your server visible along with photo. New comments/likes will be published still there.
data.comment: PhotoRights.xaml: show hint after changing rights to what implications this change could have

data.name: textPhotoRightsRemoveContact
data.value: If the photo is not newly uploaded, it remains still visible to the no longer legitimate group/contacts if there are already comments/likes. They may add comments/likes still for the photo.
data.comment: PhotoRights.xaml: show hint after changing rights to what implications this change could have

data.name: radiobuttonPhotoRightsPrivate.Content
data.comment: PhotoRights.xaml: radiobutton for selecting if photo is publicly or limited visible - limited

data.name: radiobuttonPhotoRightsPublic.Content
data.comment: PhotoRights.xaml: radiobutton for selecting if photo is publicly or limited visible - public photo

data.name: textblockPhotoACLContacts.Text
data.comment: PhotoRights.xaml: header text for the contact selector

data.name: textblockPhotoACLGroups.Text
data.comment: PhotoRights.xaml: header text for the group selector

data.name: textblockPhotoACLContactsHint.Text
data.value: You can of course set permissions for individual contacts. However, this has the problem that the permissions for the comment/liken of your photos cannot be changed afterwards. If you want to add more contacts in hindsight for the photo, they are can see the photo in your profile, but they can not see comments/likes of other contacts and may not comment themselve. We advise you to set up the permissions on photos by groups. Thus, you can add new contacts to the group or remove group members.
data.comment: PhotoRights.xaml: hint on using contacts for photo access rights as these could cause issues, hint to use groups as they are better supported.

data.name: textblockPhotoACLContactsHintHeader.Text
data.value: Note about the use of individual contacts in the permission of photos...
data.comment: PhotoRights.xaml: text shown for user to click to show the flyout with the detailed explanation why single contacts are not good for photo rights

data.name: messageDialogPhotoRightsNoContactData
data.value: The contact details were not yet fully loaded, you want to try it again?
data.comment: PhotosRights.xaml: app loads all contact data into listboxes, if contacts haven't been loaded yet in background, ask user to retry

data.name: messageDialogPhotoRightsNoContactSelected
data.value: You want to set the photo to not publicly visible, but selected no groups or contacts. Please select at least one group or a contact.
data.comment: PhotosRights.xaml: user has not selected any group or contact for a private visible photo. Ask him/her for making photo publicly visible or not?

data.name: textblockShowThreadNoDataPhoto.Text
data.value: To the selected photo, there are still no comments, likes, or dislikes.
data.comment: ShowThread.xaml: show an info if there were no comments, likes, dislikes for a photo

data.name: appBarPhotosShowPreviews.ToolTipService.ToolTip
data.value: Shows previews of profile images in the respective sizes...
data.comment: PhotosCropping.xaml: tooltip of the appbarButton for displaying the preview images on mobile devices

data.name: textblockPhotosLoadingCroppingArea.Text
data.value: Import the high-resolution version of the image into the cropping area ...
data.comment: PhotosCropping.xaml: red info box to user showing that app is currently importing the photo in high resolution into cropping area

data.name: messageDialogPhotosPrintingNotPossible
data.value: Printing is not possible at the moment!
data.comment: Photos.xaml: dialog message to user when printing throws an error

data.name: appBarNewsfeedSetAllSeen.Label
data.comment: Newsfeed.xaml: caption of the appbarButton for setting all posts as seen

data.name: appBarNewsfeedSetAllSeen.ToolTipService.ToolTip
data.comment: Newsfeed.xaml: tooltip of the appbarButton for setting all posts as seen

data.name: textblockNewsfeedIsLoadingInitial.Text
data.value: The app is loading your newsfeed items. Please have some patience.
data.comment: Newsfeed.xaml: status update for user during loading initial entries of newsfeed/network

data.name: textblockNewsfeedNoDataAvailable.Text
data.value: No newsfeed items returned from your server.
data.comment: Newsfeed.xaml: showing info text to user if there are no newsfeed items in the network timeline of the user

data.name: textblockNewsfeedNoSettings.Text
data.value: You have not defined in the app settings a Friendica server. Below we will show example data, showing you how your feed items could look in the app.
data.comment: Newsfeed.xaml: show text if user has not set any app settings (we are showing only sample data for news feed items)

data.name: messageDialogNetworkNoSettings
data.value: You cannot load older or newer posts in the test mode. Please specify in the settings your server and credentials.
data.comment: Newsfeed.xaml/Network.xaml: if no settings users can look at samples, but when they try to refresh or load older posts, they will get this error message

data.name: messageDialogNewPostDontSelectRetweetContent
data.value: This symbol like a flower represents the original content inserted in your post when you are sending it. You cannot change the symbol.
data.comment: NewPost.xaml: information displayed to user when clicking on the flower symbol for the retweeting content

data.name: messageDialogNewsfeedLikesNoDefault
data.value:
This is a RSS/Atom item. Your contacts will not see when you like/dislike on this item directly. The app could retweet this item with your default privacy settings for new posts and then set your like/dislike on this new retweet.
Currently this is not possible, because you haven't yet set default privacy settings.
data.comment: Newsfeed.xaml: likes/dislikes on newsfeed items do not work directly, inform user that he needs to define standard access rights in the settings.

data.name: messageDialogNewsfeedNotLikable
data.value:
This is a RSS/Atom item. Your contacts will not see when you like/dislike on this item directly. The app will retweet this item with your default privacy settings for new posts ({0}). The like/dislike will then be set on this new retweet.
Do you want to continue?
data.comment: Newsfeed.xaml: likes/dislikes on newsfeed items do not work directly, app will perform a retweet with the standard settings for privacy of new posts (standard setting will be displayed in {0} parameter

data.name: pageTitleNewsfeed.Text
data.comment: Name on top of view Newsfeed

data.name: pageNewsfeed.FlowDirection
data.comment: Defines Text direction for the language

data.name: switchNotificationEachNewsfeedAllowed.Header
data.value: Show notification for each RSS post element
data.comment: Settings.xaml: user can decide whether app should notify about each RSS feed element separately or send a summary notification when there are some new elements

data.name: textblockNotificationEachNewsfeedAllowedHint.Text
data.value: When having registered for some feeds, it can be annoying if the app is notifying you about each RSS post separately. The app will send you only one general notification in each run if there are one or more new RSS posts, if toggle is disabled here.
data.comment: Settings.xaml: hint on NotificationEachNewsfeedAllowed

data.name: toastNewsfeedGeneralNotification
data.value: {0} new RSS feed posts arrived on server...
data.comment: BackgroundTask: alternative text if user don't want to get notified about each rss feed post separately ("New RSS feed posts arrived") - {0} = number of new elements
